item.title: Advanced Blog Features in Chiron
item.dc:creator: Laura Bianchi
item.description: Explore the advanced features of Chiron's blog plugin including categories, tags, and multilingual support.
item.content:encoded:
# Advanced Blog Features in Chiron
Now that you're familiar with the basics, let's dive into some advanced features that make Chiron's blog plugin truly powerful.
## Categories and Tags
Organize your content effectively:
- **Categories**: Broad topics (Tutorial, News, Updates) - **Tags**: Specific keywords for granular filtering
Both are automatically indexed and linked, creating a rich navigation structure.
## Multilingual Support
Chiron detects languages automatically:
``` content/ blog/ en/ post.md it/ post.md ```
No configuration needed! The plugin adapts to your structure.
## Custom Templates
Power users can override default templates by creating files in `custom-templates/`:
- `blog-post.ejs` - Single post layout - `blog-index.ejs` - Post listing - `blog-category.ejs` - Category archive - `blog-archive.ejs` - Date-based archive
## Performance Optimizations
The blog plugin includes several performance features:
- **Lazy Loading**: Images load on demand - **Pagination**: Configurable posts per page - **Static Generation**: No runtime overhead - **CSS Variables**: Theme integration without conflicts
## Accessibility First
Every template includes:
- Semantic HTML5 elements - ARIA labels for screen readers - Keyboard navigation support - High contrast ratios
Try it yourself and see the difference! ðŸŽ¨

item.content:encoded:
# Getting Started with Chiron Blog
Welcome to your first blog post! This demonstrates the power and simplicity of Chiron's blog plugin.
## Why Choose Chiron?
Chiron makes creating a blog incredibly simple:
- **Zero Configuration**: Works out of the box with sensible defaults - **Fully Customizable**: Power users can override templates and styles - **SEO Optimized**: Built-in meta tags and structured data - **Accessible**: ARIA labels and semantic HTML throughout - **Performance**: Static files mean blazing fast load times
## Writing Your First Post
Creating a blog post is as simple as creating a Markdown file in `content/blog/`:
```markdown --- title: "My First Post" date: 2025-01-15 author: "Your Name" ---
Your content here! ```
That's it! The blog plugin handles the rest.
## What's Next?
In the next posts, we'll explore:
1. Customizing templates 2. Adding categories and tags 3. Multilingual content 4. Advanced features
Happy blogging! ðŸš€

item.title: Welcome to Chiron Static Site Generator
item.dc:creator: Sofia Bianchi
item.description: Discover how Chiron makes static site generation simple, fast, and flexible with its plugin architecture and EJS templating.
item.content:encoded:
# Welcome to Chiron
Chiron is a modern static site generator built with Node.js and EJS templating. Whether you're building documentation, a blog, or a complete website, Chiron provides the tools you need.
## Why Chiron?
### ðŸš€ Fast and Lightweight Chiron generates static HTML files that load instantly. No server-side processing, no databases, just pure speed.
### ðŸ§© Plugin Architecture Extend functionality with plugins. The blog plugin you're reading this on? That's a first-class plugin using the same architecture available to you.
### ðŸŽ¨ Theme System Complete control over design with EJS templates and CSS. Themes are just templates - no lock-in, no complexity.
### ðŸŒ Multilingual Support Built-in i18n support with language detection, fallback chains, and per-language content organization.
## Key Features
### WordPress-Style Template Helpers If you've worked with WordPress, you'll feel right at home:
```ejs <%= the_date(page, 'long') %> <%= the_author(page, {avatar: true, showSocial: true}) %> <%= the_categories(page) %> <%= the_tags(page) %> ```
### Flexible Plugin System 15 lifecycle hooks give you complete control: - `content:before-scan` - Register custom content types - `markdown:after-parse` - Enrich metadata - `build:before-start` - Initialize generators - `build:end` - Generate feeds, sitemaps, archives
### Developer Experience Clean, intuitive APIs with sensible defaults and full customization:
```javascript // Get posts with filtering const posts = get_posts({ category: 'tutorials', limit: 5, language: 'en' });
// Count posts const count = get_posts_count({ tag: 'javascript' }); ```
## Getting Started
1. **Install Chiron** ```bash npm install -g chiron-ssg ```
2. **Create a New Project** ```bash chiron init my-site cd my-site ```
3. **Start Building** ```bash chiron build chiron serve ```
## What's Next?
Check out these resources: - [Documentation](../../index.html) - Complete guides and API reference - [Plugin Development](../../index.html) - Build your own plugins - [Theme Customization](../../index.html) - Create custom themes
---
**Ready to build something amazing?** Chiron is here to help. Fast, flexible, and built for developers who value simplicity.

item.content:encoded:
# Building Modern Documentation Sites
Documentation is the backbone of any successful project. With Chiron, creating beautiful, maintainable documentation has never been easier.
## Why Static for Documentation?
Static sites offer several advantages for documentation:
1. **Speed**: No database queries, no server processing 2. **Security**: No attack surface, just HTML files 3. **Versioning**: Documentation lives with your code 4. **Portability**: Deploy anywhere, from GitHub Pages to CDNs
## Chiron's Documentation Features
### Automatic Table of Contents Every page gets a dynamically generated TOC based on your heading structure:
```markdown # Main Title ## Section 1 ### Subsection 1.1 ## Section 2 ```
The sidebar automatically reflects your content structure.
### Syntax Highlighting Code blocks are beautifully highlighted with Prism.js:
```javascript function greet(name) { console.log(`Hello, ${name}!`); }
greet('Chiron'); ```
```python def calculate_fibonacci(n): if n <= 1: return n return calculate_fibonacci(n-1) + calculate_fibonacci(n-2) ```
### Breadcrumb Navigation Users always know where they are with automatic breadcrumbs: Home > Documentation > Building Modern Documentation Sites
### Search Integration Full-text search powered by Lunr.js (via plugin) helps users find what they need instantly.
## Best Practices
### 1. Clear Structure Organize content logically: ``` content/ â”œâ”€â”€ getting-started/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ index.md â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ installation.md â”‚ â””â”€â”€ quick-start.md â”œâ”€â”€ guides/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ configuration.md â”‚ â””â”€â”€ deployment.md â””â”€â”€ api/ â””â”€â”€ reference.md ```
### 2. Consistent Frontmatter Use metadata consistently across pages: ```yaml --- title: "Page Title" description: "Brief description for SEO" category: "Guides" order: 1 --- ```
### 3. Cross-Linking Link between related pages to improve navigation and SEO: ```markdown See also: [Configuration Guide](../guides/configuration.html) ```
### 4. Code Examples Provide working examples with explanations: ```javascript // Good: Explain what the code does const config = loadConfig(); // Load from chiron.config.yaml ```
## Multilingual Documentation
Chiron makes multilingual docs effortless:
``` content/ â”œâ”€â”€ en/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ getting-started.md â”œâ”€â”€ it/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ getting-started.md â””â”€â”€ es/ â””â”€â”€ getting-started.md ```
Language detection and fallbacks are automatic.
## Advanced Features
### Custom Shortcodes Extend Markdown with reusable components: ```markdown {{< alert type="warning" >}} This feature is experimental {{< /alert >}}
{{< tabs >}} {{< tab name="JavaScript" >}} ```javascript console.log('Hello'); ``` {{< /tab >}} {{< tab name="Python" >}} ```python print('Hello') ``` {{< /tab >}} {{< /tabs >}} ```
### Custom Templates Create specialized layouts for API docs, tutorials, or changelogs: ```yaml --- template: "api-reference.ejs" --- ```
### Analytics Integration Track documentation usage with privacy-respecting analytics: ```yaml # chiron.config.yaml analytics: provider: "plausible" domain: "docs.example.com" ```
## Deployment
Deploy your documentation anywhere:
**GitHub Pages:** ```yaml # .github/workflows/deploy.yml - name: Build docs run: npm run build - name: Deploy uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v3 ```
**Netlify:** ```toml # netlify.toml [build] command = "npm run build" publish = "docs" ```
**Vercel:** ```json { "buildCommand": "npm run build", "outputDirectory": "docs" } ```
## Conclusion
Chiron provides everything you need for modern documentation: - Fast static generation - Clean, maintainable structure - Powerful customization - Easy deployment
Start building better docs today! ðŸ“š
